revised_title: Preserving Ships from Worm Infestation: Historical Methods and Solutions
tldr: This article discusses the problem of ships being damaged by worms in the Indies and various methods tried to prevent it. Some methods include using deal, hair, and lime, scorched ships, and finding a harder kind of wood. The author mentions a proposed solution of using a bitter wood or a lixivium to give the ordinary wood the same quality. A worthy person in London suggests using pitch from sea coals as a remedy.
